required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nivolumab, S-1 Combined With Oxaliplatin Versus Nivolumab as Neoadjuvant Therapy in Advanced Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Phase II Evaluation of Nivolumab, S-1 Combined With Oxaliplatin (Nivo+SOX) Versus Nivolumab (Nivo) as Neoadjuvant Therapy in Patients With Locally Advanced Gastric Adenocarcinoma (RESONANCE-Ⅲ Study)

brief_summary.textblock: The trial is a prospective, randomized, controlled phase Ⅱ study which will be conducted in Chinese PLA General Hospital, Beijing, China. Patients with eligibility will enrolled and assigned into either group A for 9 weeks of nivolumab, S-1 combined with oxaliplatin (Nivo+SOX) followed by D2 surgery and group B for 9 weeks of nivolumab followed by D2 surgery. The primary endpoint is the safety assessed by recording adverse events and the secondary endpoints are response rate, disease control rate, pathological complete response rate, D2 rate and R0 rate.

primary_outcome.description: The safety is assessed by recording adverse events.

secondary_outcome.description: Response rate, defined as the rate of patients who achieve CR or PR according to the RESIST 1.1.
Disease control rate, defined as the rate of patients who achieve CR, PR or PD according to the RESIST 1.1.
Pathological complete response rate, defined as the rate of patients achieving pathological complete response.
The rate of patients who received D2 radical gastrectomy.
The rate of patients who received R0 resection.

intervention.description: The preoperative therapy consists of three-week cycles of intravenously administered nivolumab 360mg and oxaliplatin 130mg/m2 on day 1, and orally administered S-1 40-60 mg twice a day (BID) on day 1 to 14. The dose of S-1 depends on body surface area (BSA): BSA<1.25 m2, 40mg; 1.25<BSA<1.50 m2, 50mg; BSA>1.50 m2, 60mg. Day 15 to day 21 is the rest period.
The preoperative therapy consists of three-week cycles of intravenously administered nivolumab 360mg on day 1.

A standard D2 radical laparoscopic gastrectomy according to the CSCO clinical guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of gastric cancer is planned 3-4 weeks after the last cycle of preoperative therapy.
